This website illustrates the 23 design patterns by the Gang of Four, implemented in JavaScript. The design patterns are organized by three pattern types - creational, structural, and behavioral.

Creational patterns: ones that create objects, rather than having to instantiate objects directly. This gives the program more flexibility in deciding which objects need to be created for a given case.

Structural patterns: these concern class and object composition. They use inheritance to compose interfaces and define ways to compose objects to obtain new functionality.

Behavioral patterns: most of these design patterns are specifically concerned with communication between objects.

Source: Wikipedia.
